Working with SMS Messages in Marketing Cloud Growth

After you create your SMS message, preview it and send a test to a mobile device. To make significant changes to a published SMS message or prevent it from sending in a campaign, unpublish it.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition and the Salesforce Message Credits - SMS add-on


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create or edit content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

any CMS workspace contributor role


To publish or unpublish content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

a CMS workspace contributor role of content admin or content manager

Preview and Test an SMS Message

To ensure your customers get the best experience from your content, preview and test your SMS message in Marketing Cloud.

Before you can preview and test, publish at least one segment, and set up a sender code in Salesforce Setup. You can preview and test an SMS message in any status. Test sends count toward message credits.

Open the preview window.
When editing your message, in the main toolbar, click Preview.
From the SMS message content detail page, click Preview.
Select a segment and a sample recipient.
To configure a test send, open the Test tab.
Select a sender code to send the message from.
In the Test Send Mobile Number fields, enter up to five numbers for devices that you can easily access.
To send a test message, click Send Test.
Check the mobile device and verify that the message appears as expected.
Ensure that merge fields and shortened links display properly, especially any links that use a custom domain.
Test links to ensure that they direct your customers to the right places.
Unpublish an SMS Message

To change your SMS message back to draft status and prevent it from sending in a campaign, unpublish your SMS message in Marketing Cloud.

From your marketing workspace, open the SMS message that you want to unpublish.
From the content detail page, click Unpublish.
When you’re editing your message, from the main toolbar, click Unpublish.
Review the list of related flows and content and determine if any other changes are needed.
To unpublish the message immediately, click Unpublish Now.
To unpublish the message at a later date, click Schedule Unpublish, and schedule a date and time to unpublish it.
